gao.core

Class Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • gao.core.Index

  • public final class Index
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an spatial-index; may be a single value or an interval
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Martin Beyer

    • Field Detail

      • value

        protected long value
        Value of this index

      • endvalue

        protected long endvalue
        Deprecated. 
        End-value of the index; only needed if the index-object represents an interval

      • borders

        protected com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] borders
        Defines which borders are used to calculate the index. Needed for shifting of indexes.

      • zmax

        protected static long zmax
        Defines the maximum value which is can be used for an index-value. Problems with DBMS/Java may result if an to big value is used.

      • Index

        public Index(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] pBorders)

      • getRelated

        public Index[] getRelated()
                   throws IndexException
        Deprecated. 
        Returns all spatial-indexes which are are related to the one in the GeoData. Related means all spatial-indexes from the "layers" (=depths) above and below, which have at least an intersection with the affected spatial-index, and this spatial index itself. All Geometrys with one of these indexes may(!) be intersecting, crossing, touching, etc... a Geometry in the given index
        Returns:
        de.ohmhochschule.gao.Index[]
        Throws:
        IndexException

      • getRelatedIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Interval> getRelatedIterator()
                                                throws IndexException
        Das gleiche wie getRelated() nur als Iteratorvariante um beim testen die getRelatet Varianten austauschen zu können.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IndexException
